backstories.description: Fugitives threaten the economic balance of the station.
Customs agency ships are inspecting trading vessels.
Pirate ships are threatening transport vessels.
The engines of a vessel failed and life support systems are critical.
An enemy trading vessel is vulnerable and could be plundered.
An enemy combat vessel is passing through the area around the station unarmed.
An enemy combat vessel is patrolling the area.
An enemy attacked a civilian station and should be punished.
A spacecraft went missing in the sector of the station.
The station is running out of supplies and would pay a large price.
The station is abusing its workers and therefore selling some products very cheap.
The station was attacked and needs some investments to get going again.

questGivers.description: A large syndicate known for opportunistic and aggressive deals which drive stations into poverty and supply shortages.
A merchant who is trying his best to make fair deals. He seems to be well respected by the local population.
A ruthless politician who is known for raising support for his goals and silencing his opponents equally violently.
A member of the council. As he made his way towards you he kindly greeted some people, most of which replied with a smile.
An ambitious major who would prefer to be a commander.
A man wearing a military uniform who looks deeply worried about something.
A man with a nervous gaze. The locals look after him disdainfully.
A woman in civilian clothes with a desperate facial expression. She is gesturing anxiously.

tasks.description: Dock to a Customs Vessel and bribe the Crew
Dock to a helpless Vessel and jump-start its Engine
Dock to a helpless Vessel and supply Oxygen
Dock to a helpless Vessel and plunder it
Dock to a helpless Vessel and tow it to the Station
Sell 20 Sanitary Products to the Station
Buy Goods for at least 200$ from the Station
Dock to a Trading Vessel and plunder it
